intro: Pentalinon andrieuxii, commonly known as the Andrieux's pentalinon, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant features opposite, simple leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
